intro: Desmodium gracillimum, commonly known as slender desmodium, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets. It has a shallow root system and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. The flowers are typically pink or purple and attract various pollinators.
